snippet: A grisly forced abortion in China that renewed calls to loosen the country’s family planning law has resulted in the family receiving $11,200 from the local government.
abstract: Local government in northwest China will pay a cash settlement to a woman who was forced to undergo a grisly late-term abortion, an action that prompted a broad public outcry over family planning policy; authorities have already fired two officials, sanctioned five more and issued a formal apology in the case, a measure of the impact of the furor channeled on the Internet.
lead_paragraph: A grisly forced abortion in China that renewed calls to loosen the country’s family planning law has resulted in the family receiving $11,200 from the local government.

headline.seo: China Pays Family in Forced Abortion Case, Husband Says
headline.main: China to Pay Family in a Case of Forced Abortion
headline.print_headline: China to Pay Family in a Case of Forced Abortion
